timeline.message:
refactor(e2e): Remove JVMRunner classes, move logic to test classes

This simplifies the test project by removing a layer of inheritence that is no longer needed

timeline.bodyText: No need to clean up here. The nightly jobs will clean these identities up
timeline.author: timtay-microsoft

timeline.bodyText: Now that we don't have separate runners for tpm/symmetrickey/x509, there is no way to just tag the TPM tests as flakey since it is in the same class as symmetric key and x509
timeline.author: timtay-microsoft
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -133,7 +132,54 @@ else if (attestationType == AttestationType.TPM)
         {
             throw new IllegalArgumentException("Unknown attestation type provided");
         }
+    }
 
+    public static Collection inputs() throws Exception
+    {
+        if (IntegrationTest.isPullRequest)
+        {
+            return Arrays.asList(
+                    new Object[][]
+                            {
+                                    {ProvisioningDeviceClientTransportProtocol.HTTPS, AttestationType.X509},
+                                    {ProvisioningDeviceClientTransportProtocol.AMQPS, AttestationType.X509},
+                                    {ProvisioningDeviceClientTransportProtocol.AMQPS_WS, AttestationType.X509},
+                                    {ProvisioningDeviceClientTransportProtocol.MQTT, AttestationType.X509},
+                                    {ProvisioningDeviceClientTransportProtocol.MQTT_WS, AttestationType.X509},
+
+                                    {ProvisioningDeviceClientTransportProtocol.HTTPS, AttestationType.SYMMETRIC_KEY},
+                                    {ProvisioningDeviceClientTransportProtocol.AMQPS, AttestationType.SYMMETRIC_KEY},
+                                    {ProvisioningDeviceClientTransportProtocol.AMQPS_WS, AttestationType.SYMMETRIC_KEY},
+                                    {ProvisioningDeviceClientTransportProtocol.MQTT, AttestationType.SYMMETRIC_KEY},
+                                    {ProvisioningDeviceClientTransportProtocol.MQTT_WS, AttestationType.SYMMETRIC_KEY},
+
+                                    //TODO tpm tests are flakey, so skip them for PR runs

timeline.message:
refactor(e2e): Remove JVMRunner classes, move logic to test classes

This simplifies the test project by removing a layer of inheritence that is no longer needed

refactor(e2e): Remove JVMRunner classes, move logic to test classes

This simplifies the test project by removing a layer of inheritence that is no longer needed

timeline.bodyText: Very orthogonal, but this unit test takes 1 minute to run, and adds nothing valuable
timeline.author: timtay-microsoft

timeline.bodyText: This annotation used to sit at the JVMRunner level, but since that level no longer exists, this logic is here
timeline.author: timtay-microsoft

timeline.bodyText: nit: braces n the same line or on new line?
timeline.author: abhipsaMisra

timeline.bodyText: why do we want tests to fail if teardown fails? Anything that is relevant to the test case should be a part of the test method directly.
timeline.author: abhipsaMisra
abhipsaMisra

replies.bodyText: These tests were previously ignored through the pom file rather than in source. I'm just moving the ignore back into source so it is more obvious that this test isn't being run
replies.author: timtay-microsoft

timeline.message:
make environment variable retrieval done only at common level

works for both android and jvm

refactor(e2e): Remove JVMRunner classes, move logic to test classes

This simplifies the test project by removing a layer of inheritence that is no longer needed

This simplifies the test project by removing a layer of inheritence that is no longer needed

refactor(e2e): Remove JVMRunner classes, move logic to test classes

This simplifies the test project by removing a layer of inheritence that is no longer needed

timeline.bodyText: This might be a good time to remove these test re-runs
timeline.author: abhipsaMisra

timeline.bodyText: Do we still need these android runners? Is it for separating tests by test groups?
timeline.author: abhipsaMisra

replies.bodyText: At this point, yes, they only exist so that we can run them in smaller groups
replies.author: timtay-microsoft

timeline.bodyText: nit - and not directly related to this PR: these var names should also specify the time unit; is it 60 * 1000 ms/ 60 * 1000 secs/ 60 * 1000 mins ....?
timeline.author: abhipsaMisra

replies.bodyText: Milliseconds, and sure, I can scrub through these real fast
replies.author: timtay-microsoft

timeline.bodyText: we should log something here, to indicate that env var retrieval from buildConfig failed.
timeline.author: abhipsaMisra

replies.bodyText: Our e2e test suite currently doesn't log anything but test failures
replies.author: timtay-microsoft

replies.bodyText: I can see about adding this, though
replies.author: timtay-microsoft

timeline.bodyText: this shouldn't be required any more, correct?
timeline.author: abhipsaMisra
